page.title: 14ST. ANDREW'S MIDDLE SCHOOL.
page.content: St. Andrew's was built in 1973 with 427 pupils on roll when the school opened.The pupils came from many different backgrounds and included as well as indigenous children,pupils whose parents came from the West Indies,Asia,India,Pakistan,Iran,Greece China,Spain,Portugal and Italy.Since the school opened the number of pupils has fallen,but it is now beginning to rise again.In September there will be 190 pupils in school. The school is best known for its steel band,The Saints,who play in many parts of the country and have played in Germany.The steel band was started after a visitor for the Commonwealth Instistute suggested we try a steel band in school in 1975.Originally many West Indian children played in the band.Now pupils from many different backgrounds play in it.
